segments.text: Software development has changed
forever. The creator of Reddit believes
it. Linus Strawvolds, the Linux guy
believes it, and Theo has been banging
on about it in his latest videos. People
have been saying this since the dawn of
chat GPT. But this year, this year is
different because the models Opus 4.5,
Gemini 3, and even GPT 5.2 are really,
really good at coding. Anti-res was able
to knock out four big tasks in hours
instead of weeks. Linus Tvoltz in one of
his PRs says that anti-gravity is better
at writing code than he is. And the new
Claude Cowwork was written entirely with
Claude code. AI is no longer producing
slop and some of the best programmers in
the industry are no longer writing code
by hand. So what should you do?
According to this blog post from
Anti-Res, it's time to take AI seriously
and use it to multiply yourself. No more
tab completions, no 5-minute projects.
Use it for something big and push it to
do things you won't expect it to do.
Unless you're learning a new language
for fun, stop crafting code and start
designing systems to write code. Don't
fall into the anti-AI hype.

fullText: Software development has changed forever. The creator of Reddit believes it. Linus Strawvolds, the Linux guy believes it, and Theo has been banging on about it in his latest videos. People have been saying this since the dawn of chat GPT. But this year, this year is different because the models Opus 4.5, Gemini 3, and even GPT 5.2 are really, really good at coding. Anti-res was able to knock out four big tasks in hours instead of weeks. Linus Tvoltz in one of his PRs says that anti-gravity is better at writing code than he is. And the new Claude Cowwork was written entirely with Claude code. AI is no longer producing slop and some of the best programmers in the industry are no longer writing code by hand. So what should you do? According to this blog post from Anti-Res, it's time to take AI seriously and use it to multiply yourself. No more tab completions, no 5-minute projects. Use it for something big and push it to do things you won't expect it to do. Unless you're learning a new language for fun, stop crafting code and start designing systems to write code. Don't fall into the anti-AI hype.
